seniority_level.evidence: Minimum 4+ years experience required, title is Data Engineer (typically senior level in enterprise contexts), responsibilities include complex pipeline development and cloud platform expertise

job_family.evidence: Job title explicitly states 'Data Engineer', core responsibilities focus on building data pipelines, processing data with Spark, and working with big data technologies

sub_specialty.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'Experience in developing streaming pipelines' and 'Exposure to streaming solutions and message brokers like Kafka technologies'

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of people management, team leadership, or architectural oversight beyond individual contribution; responsibilities focus on development and testing of data solutions

primary_cloud.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'Azure Cloud Data Platform' multiple times, lists Azure-specific services (Azure HDInsight, Azure Data Factory, Synapse), and requires 3+ years experience on Azure

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) are mentioned in the job description or requirements

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions both 'streaming pipelines' and batch processing via Spark on Hadoop/Azure platforms; no exclusive focus on one paradigm

orchestrator_category.evidence: Azure Data Factory and Synapse are explicitly mentioned as required technologies, which are cloud-native orchestration tools

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions both HDFS (lake-like storage) and Azure SQL Server DB/Synapse (warehouse-like storage), indicating use of both paradigms

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as 'Bengaluru East, Karnataka, India' with no mention of remote flexibility; implies regional presence required

timezone_focus.evidence: Location restricted to Bengaluru, India, indicating focus on Indian time zone and local team alignment

relocation_required.evidence: Location is fixed to Bengaluru East, Karnataka, India with no remote option mentioned; implies candidate must be able to relocate or already reside there

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship; location is in India, suggesting local hiring only

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visas or OPT/CPT; location in India suggests local hiring with work authorization requirements

citizenship_required.evidence: Location in India implies requirement to be authorized to work locally; no citizenship requirement stated

w2_vs_1099.evidence: IBM is a large enterprise; job appears to be full-time permanent position with no mention of contract or freelance arrangements

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits are mentioned in the job posting or Pass 1 extraction results

growth_path_clarity.evidence: No explicit career tracks mentioned; general reference to 'delivering deep technical expertise' but no specific advancement paths

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions working in 'IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers' with 'deep technical expertise' which implies collaboration with experienced team members, but no formal mentorship program stated

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression in the job description

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, role changes, or mobility opportunities

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks (IC, management, specialist, architect) mentioned in the job description

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between 'Required' and 'Preferred' skills; 4+ years experience required with specific technologies, but some flexibility in preferred certifications

scope_definition.evidence: Focused role on data engineering with specific technologies (Spark, Azure, Kafka) and responsibilities (pipeline development, testing, transformation)

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: 4+ years experience aligns with senior data engineer expectations; required skills are standard for the role and cloud platform; no unrealistic combinations
